body:
Hi @caarlos0,

with `meta: true`, the linux packages does not contain the binary and the shared library which are build by goreleaser before. Thats atleast what I expect by reading the comment, but it does not solve the bug here.
ah, right, sorry, I misunderstood the problem
okay, so, basically, we should support adding libraries to nfpm packages too instead of just binaries.

what you think would be a good api for this?

we have `nfpms[x].bindir` to set the directory in which the binary will go (default `/usr/bin`), should we do the same for shared libraries?

also worth mentioning that we can have headers, c-shared and c-archive, not sure if they usually go to different folders or not.

---

on a side note, this further adds to a point I made previously somewhere: we need to improve all this for v2.

Your proposal sounds good to me.

Could it be possible to address the c-libaries in content for now and do an overhoul in v2 as you mention?

Otherwise header and lib dir maybe sufficent for now.

> Could it be possible to address the c-libaries in content for now and do an overhoul in v2 as you mention?

I think it should be possible if you know the path inside `dist`

And I also rather do this "right" for v2. I started a RFC https://github.com/orgs/goreleaser/discussions/4407

issue.title: feat(nfpm): support libraries

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
This adds `nfpm.libdirs` to allow to set where to put libraries built, as well as include them in the search for artifacts when building the package.

closes #4346

---

PS: I'm not sure about the default dirs, let me know what you think!
